meanings.definition: Incapable of being violated or infringed upon.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins held an inviolableness that left visitors in awe.
meanings.sent2: The treaty was signed with the inviolableness of ensuring peace for generations to come.
meanings.sent3: The inviolableness of the secret recipe made it the most sought-after dish in town.
meanings.sent4: Her inviolableness in keeping promises earned her the trust of everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The inviolableness of the castle walls withstood every attack from the enemy.

meanings.definition: The quality of being secure from destruction or profanation.
meanings.sent1: The inviolableness of the ancient artifact was ensured by the museum's security measures.
meanings.sent2: The inviolableness of the temple was respected by all who visited.
meanings.sent3: The inviolableness of the treasure chest was a mystery that intrigued many adventurers.
meanings.sent4: The inviolableness of the forest sanctuary was a symbol of peace and harmony.
meanings.sent5: The inviolableness of the historic documents was crucial for preserving the nation's heritage.
